None of this is actually accurate to time dilation. Downvoted for misinformation.
Time dilation occurs with speed relative to other things, has nothing to do with altitude. Satellites are moving very fast relative to the earth, hence their faster time relative to earth time.

Those buffs make it a lot better. Most people don't realize but the NC already has a fast rudder and quick turning radius. You should be able to get all guns on target with NO because of how quick and tight the turning is. Even then, those guns will put out less avg damage than Mogami in most situations. Only way NO is favored is an AP fight vs other cruisers close range. But if your opponent is smart they'll just use HE and make your small health pool go down a chunk at a time.
T8 and above get accuracy buffs, secondary buffs, AA buffs, rear turret firing angle buffs, and speed buffs.

155 Mogami is not too great because of the turret rotation. 203 Mogami is a beast though. Great concealment with great maneuverability and fire chance I feel gets too often overlooked by the 155 nerf. If it wasn't for the heal on the Atago, I would argue 203 Mogami is the better ship.
New Orleans I don't like. 35k HP doesn't cut it at T8+. Everything else about it is good though.
